launchInExternalBrowser.description: The variable is replaced by the browser name (Firefox, Chrome, Safari, etc)

launchInExternalBrowserLink.description: The variable is replaced by the browser name (Firefox, Chrome, Safari, etc)

welcomeHeading.description: 'Firefox Bridge' is the name of the extension. Do not translate 'Firefox Bridge'.

addCurrentSiteToMySitesContextMenu.description: The variable is replaced by the current site’s second-level domain (e.g. 'mozilla.org')

notInstalledErrorText.message: Firefox Bridge requires Firefox to be installed on your computer.

welcomePageSubtitleFirefox.message: Switch between browsers in one click.

welcomePageDescriptionFirefox.message:
Sometimes, you just want to use a different browser.
This extension helps you easily open sites in other browsers.

welcomePageSubtitleChromium.message: Switch from your current browser to Firefox in one click.

welcomePageDescriptionChromium.message: Sometimes, you just want a more private browser. This extension helps you easily open sites in Firefox.

welcomePageAlwaysPrivateCheckbox.message: Always open sites in a Firefox Private Window when switching

welcomePageTelemetryCheckbox.message: Allow Mozilla to collect information about how you use this extension so we can make it better. Privacy Notice

welcomePageNoShortcutsFirefox.message: You don’t have any shortcuts set up for this extension. Create them by going to extension settings.

welcomePageNoShortcutsChromium.message: You don’t have any shortcuts set up for this extension. Create them by going to extension settings.

welcomePageNoShortcutTo.message: You don’t have a shortcut set up for launching your current page in $browser$
welcomePageNoShortcutTo.description: The variable is replaced by the browser name (Firefox, Chrome, Safari, etc)

welcomePageYesShortcutTo.description: The first variable is replaced by the hotkey to launch the current page in a browser. The second variable is replaced by the browser name (Firefox, Chrome, Safari, etc)

welcomePageNoShortcutToFirefoxPrivate.message: You don’t have a shortcut set up for launching your current page in Firefox Private Browsing

welcomePageYesShortcutToFirefoxPrivate.message: $hotkey$ launches your current page in Firefox Private Browsing
welcomePageYesShortcutToFirefoxPrivate.description: The variable is replaced by the hotkey to launch the current page in Firefox Private Browsing

welcomePageManageShortcutsFirefox.message: Find shortcuts for this extension by going to extension settings.

welcomePageManageShortcutsChromium.message: Find shortcuts for this extension by going to extension settings.

welcomePageTryFirefox.message: Want to hop back to Firefox? Try our Chromium extension.

welcomePageTryChromium.message: Hop back from another browser with our extension in Firefox.

welcomePageNoExternalBrowserErrorChromiu.message: Looks like Firefox isn’t installed on this device. Download Now

welcomePageNoExternalBrowserErrorFirefox.message: Looks like you don’t have another browser on this device
